overview: This subject serves as a capstone subject for the Master of Management (Marketing) integrating previous knowledge and skills acquired in other marketing subjects. This subject examines the task of preparing, implementing, and adjusting strategic marketing decisions and plans. It also introduces students to the tasks of utilising market information to identify and evaluate marketing strategies and gives students the opportunity to learn, examine and apply strategic decision processes in a business environment. The subject is application-oriented and makes extensive use of a simulation.

necessary pre-requisite: Completion of a minimum of 62.5 credit points of study
alternate pre-requisite: Admission into the 150pt Program course entry point in the MC-MGMTMKT Master of Management (Marketing)

necessary pre-requisite: Completion of a minimum of 112.5 credit points of study
alternate pre-requisite: Admission into the 200pt Program course entry point in the MC-MGMTMKT Master of Management (Marketing)
Students are encouraged to take the subject in their final Semester of study where practical.

assessments.description: Group marketing plan (usually in groups of 4-5). 3000 words
Group presentation to the executive board (15 minutes plus 5 minute Q&A) (usually in groups of 4-5). 20 minutes
Individual contribution to weekly executive briefings. 15 minutes
Overall simulation performance (usually in groups of 4-5). 16 hours

Prescribed texts: You will be advised of prescribed texts by your lecturer.

Related Handbook entries: This subject contributes to the following:
Available to Study Abroad and/or Study E: This subject is available to students studying at the University from eligible overseas institutions on exchange and study abroad. Students are required to satisfy any listed requirements, such as pre- and co-requisites, for enrolment in the subject.
